task.title: Extract a disk from a vSphere virtual machine
task.shortdesc: To migrate a disk in VMDK format from vSphere to Eucalyptus, perform the following steps.

step.cmd: Download the Eucalyptus Image Tools from github:

info.codeblock: yum install python-pip git pip-python install -U psphere git clone https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-image-tools.git cd eucalyptus-image-tools

step.cmd: Download the disk image from vSphere, supplying your vSphere IP address, login, password, and VM name. For example:

info.codeblock: python tools/exporters/export_vmdk.py --ip 10.111.1.133 \ --user your-vsphere-login --password your-vsphere-password \ --vmName your-vm-name --workDir /path.to/yourworkdir Downloading 490 bytes File saved to /path.to/yourworkdir/your-vm-name.vmdk Downloading 5473598976 bytes File saved to /path.to/yourworkdir/your-vm-name-flat.vmdk

p.note: The command will fail if the VM has more than one disk or NIC.

step.cmd: Convert the VMDK into a raw disk image:

info.codeblock: cd /path.to/yourworkdir sudo qemu-img convert -O raw your-vm-name.vmdk disk.raw
info.p: This command will create a raw disk image which can then be bundled, uploaded, and registered with Eucalyptus. When registering the converted disk image, you must specify the --virtualization-type=hvm option when running the euca-register command line tool.)
